meanings.definition: A person or group that promotes or advocates for a particular idea or belief.
meanings.sent1: The promulgators of environmental awareness campaigns work tirelessly to spread their message.
meanings.sent2: The promulgators of healthy eating habits often share recipes and tips on social media.
meanings.sent3: The promulgators of the 'eat your vegetables' movement are quite persuasive.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the promulgators of new trends hold significant influence.
meanings.sent5: The promulgators of kindness aim to make the world a better place, one act at a time.

meanings.definition: An official or organization that announces or makes known a law or decree.
meanings.sent1: The promulgators of the new school policy informed all students during assembly.
meanings.sent2: Government promulgators ensure that citizens are aware of changes in legislation.
meanings.sent3: The promulgators of the 'no homework on weekends' rule were met with cheers from students.
meanings.sent4: The promulgators of traffic laws play a crucial role in maintaining order on the roads.
meanings.sent5: The promulgators of safety regulations strive to protect workers from harm in the workplace.
